articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian officials threatened the West on Saturday with an uncontrolled escalation of war and Ukraine with the destruction of Kyiv as Western leaders discussed whether to allow Ukraine to use their weapons for strikes deep into Russian territory.
articles.title: Russia threatens Ukraine, West as long-range strikes decision looms

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: NATO could have done more to arm Ukraine to try to prevent Russia's invasion in 2022, the outgoing head of the Western military alliance said in an interview released on Saturday.
articles.title: Stoltenberg says NATO could have done more to prevent Ukraine war, FAS reports

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ugandan Olympic runner Rebecca Cheptegei, who died after allegedly being doused in petrol and set alight by her former partner, was due to be buried on Saturday with full military honours.
articles.title: Slain Ugandan Olympian buried with full military honours

articles.author: Ammu Kannampilly
articles.description: On the morning of Sunday Sept. 1, Olympic marathon runner Rebecca Cheptegei was preparing to go to church from her home in the highlands of western Kenya. Her ex-boyfriend called a friend of his to ask if he could borrow a lighter.
articles.title: Olympic runner Cheptegei defied her violent ex. She lost her life anyway

articles.author: Andrew Osborn, Lucy Papachristou
articles.description: Splits in Russia's opposition in exile have widened sharply, shifting their focus from political activism to infighting after allies of late opposition leader Alexei Navalny accused another opposition figure of ordering attacks on their activists.
articles.title: Infighting rocks Russia's exiled opposition as Navalny allies accuse colleagues of foul play

articles.author: Amanda Perobelli, Anthony Boadle
articles.description: Brazil has almost squashed the illegal gold rush that led thousands of wildcat miners into the Yanomami reservation in the Amazon rainforest and caused a humanitarian crisis of disease and malnutrition, the man in charge of operations said.
articles.title: Brazil says it has nearly cleared gold miners from Amazon Yanomami reservation

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's military on Saturday condemned the transit of two German navy ships through the Taiwan Strait saying it increased security risks and sent the "wrong" signal, adding that Chinese forces monitored and warned the vessels.
articles.title: China condemns German navy's transit of Taiwan Strait

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The head of a Malaysian conglomerate accused of running homes where hundreds of children and youths were allegedly sexually abused said there were 'one or two' cases of sodomy at the shelters but he denied other allegations of misconduct.
articles.title: CEO of Malaysia firm accused of child abuse says there were cases of sodomy

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iran launched its Chamran-1 research satellite into orbit on Saturday, its second successful satellite launch this year, state media reported.
articles.title: Iran launches second satellite this year into orbit, state media says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least four people died in eastern Romania after torrential rain caused flooding, the country's emergency response unit said on Saturday, as river levels surged in several other central and eastern European nations following days of heavy rainfall.
articles.title: At least four die in Romania floods as rain batters central Europe
